attributes.action: Reinstate UK citizenship for Kurdish refugees.
attributes.additional_details: The refugees at the time feared repercussions on their family from the government of that time, so they changed names and date of birth in order not to be detected in this country. We want parliament to acknowledge this and return the passports of these British citizens who have integrated into this country for the past 15 years and more.
attributes.background: We want the government to reinstate UK citizenship for Kurdish refugees who changed there details when they came to UK due to fear of persecution by Saddam's Iraq.

rejection.details:
We're not sure what you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to do. 

You can find information on how to apply for British citizenship again renouncing British citizenship here:  https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/form-rs1-guidance

You can find out about specialist immigration help here:

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/immigration/get-help/get-immigration-advice/

If you need help to start a petition, you can contact us at petitionscommittee@parliament.uk
